metadata.title: Surficial Sediments of the Eastern Bering Sea Continental Shelf: EBSSED Database Documentation

creators.name: Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS), Alaska Fisheries Science Center (AFSC)

metadata.description: The texture of surficial sediments, defined as the size-frequency distribution of unconsolidated grains, is an important attribute of the coastal ocean environment.  In addition to purely geological applications, data of this type have great utility in habitat studies seeking to explain the distribution and abundance of important biological resources.  (Reference: Smith, K.R., and R.A. McConnaughey. 1999. Surficial sediments of the eastern Bering Sea continental shelf: EBSSED database documentation. U.S. Dep. Commer., NOAA Tech. Memo. NMFS-AFSC-104, 41p. http://www.afsc.noaa.gov/race/media/publications/archives/pubs1999/techmemo104.pdf)
